review_blob: Fizzy orange color with HUGE white head. Creamy strong yeast with some grass aroma. Light sour and quite bitter taste. Quite bitter and yeasty aftertaste too. Dont like this one.
0.33 at 2. Craft beer festival in Garden Mall Zagreb. Clear golden color with small white head. Malty aroma, light sweet taste. Definitely not IPA. Beer is OK, but style is missed.
0.33 at 2. Craft beer festival in Garden Mall Zagreb. Hazy light brown color with big white head. Medium pine aroma with citrus notes. Taste is light sweet, light bitter and refreshing. Nice APA.

0.3 on tap at 2. Craft beer festival in Garden Mall Zagreb. Black color with small brown head. Chocolate and malty  aroma, flavorful but light. Medium sweet taste with light dry aftertaste. Unexpectedly drinkable for stout.
0.33 on tap at 2. Craft beer festival in Garden Mall Zagreb. Hazy golden color with small white head. Grass and yeast aroma. Bitter taste that last quite long.
Clear golden color with medium white head. Clove and yeast aroma with some hitns of spices. Sweet taste. Nicely covered alc. 9%.
Blonde color with thick white head. Clove aroma, with hints of banana and light spicy notes. Medium sweet taste. Really awesome value for price.

Clear golden color with medium sized white head. Strong hops aroma. Nice hop bitterness. Medium and dry body with surprisingly pleasant sweetness in aftertaste. Just as described summer APA. It has its aroma but it is not heavy beer.
Hazy light green color, almost lemonade color, small fast disappearing head. Lime aroma, feels artificial. Almost no sourness. But it taste good, like one tasty limeonade.
Pale yellow color with small white head. Grassy with some slight maltiness. Bittery finish slight maltiness and waterish taste is present through all taste experiance.
Canned. Hazy orange with a small white head. Some artificial grapefruit aroma.
Canned. Clear golden color, no foam. Watery, slight corn aroma, mostly watery. It is drinkable and surprisingly low bitter.
Canned. Clear golden color with medium white head. Aroma of malt and grain. Taste is surprisingly malty sweet and almost not bitter at all.
Dark color with huge brown head. Light burnt malt aroma. Watery and medium bitter aftertaste. Its ok but way to light for stout.

Dark amber color with huge brown head. Strong hop bitterness in aftertaste. Burnt malt aroma with some hop notes in aftertaste. It has a full body, but its bitterness overtakes beer. It is not balanced it has strange bitter mix between burnt malt and hop bitterness.
Ruby color with medium creamy brownish head and fruity smell. Raisins, dried fruit and brown sugar. Medium fruity sweet taste with bitter and malty aftertaste. Medium and creamy body,

Extra light orange color, with medium white head.Wheat and yeast with slight spices on palate. Sweet taste with slight bitter aftertaste. Medium body but not really balanced. Not really impressed with this one.

Hazy orange color with small white fast disappearing head. Light malty, medium yeasty and some bread aroma. Sweet and sticky taste. Light bitter aftertaste and light carbonation. It is too light like I mentioned three times.
Full orange color with big white head. Medium wheat and some yeast aroma, taste is light sweet with medium body and fast fading aftertaste. One solid weizen.

beer_brewer_name: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review_blob: Brown color with medium thick micro foamed white head. Banana, liquorice, plum, some light roasted malt notes. Taste is medium sweet with light dry aftertaste. Big body, really flavorful beer.
Orange color, lively carbonation, medium white head. Refreshing fruitiness(raisins) with some spicy notes. Light sourness and bitterness with fruity sweetness. Medium body with dry aftertaste.
Dark red color with medium brown head. Some light spices aroma and raisins notes. Taste is light to medium sweet with dry aftertaste. Light body and light carbonation. Not impressed at all.
On tap at Craft Room Zagreb. Yellow cloudy color with small white head. Nice wheat aroma with full body. Medium sweet taste, easy drinkable.
On tap at Pivnica Medvedgrad Ilica. Brown color with big brownish head. Wheat, light malt and banana aroma. Taste is sweet and little watery. Too light body.

Clear amber color with small white head. Light malty aroma(they say three types of malt, well I am surprised I even sense malt at all). Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Slight better than other Pan beers. At least there is not that bad sourness and bitterness their lagers have.
Clear golden color with small white head. Some light malty aroma. Surprisingly good and not plain and watery.

Beautiful orange color with small frothy white head. Strong hops aroma with pine notes. Medium bitterness, really surprised by that. Medium body with dry finish. Refreshing without that strong bitterness that I was expecting in DIPA.
beer_name: Mali Grad The Girl from Ipanema

review_blob: Clear golden color with big white head. Grass aroma with some malty notes. Bitter taste with sweet palate.
Light brown to amber color with brownish head. Fruity hops with some light pine notes. Light bitter taste with light sweet finish. Medium body with some malty aftertaste. Really refreshing.

Clear red color without head. Dried fruits aroma. But artificial extra sweet and sticky taste with quite bitter finish. Too sweet for me and this bitterness is not helping either. Worst Lasko Special. I know they covered high ABV with such taste, but still not an excuse for making bad beer.

Clear red color with small white head. Light malty aroma with light bitter. Light body with non existing(too fast fading) aftertaste. I know this is Ozujsko, but I still had hope they can make little different lager.
Orange unclear color with big frothy white head. Citrus and hops aroma. Medium sweet and light bitter taste. Medium body with orange bitter aftertaste.
Orange color with small white head. Herbal, pine and orange peel aroma. Bitter-sweet taste. Lively carbonation. Little too bitter and it is missing some hop aroma.
Canned. Clear golden color with small white head, but there is something small like dust floating inside it. Light grass aroma. Light sweet and somehow sour taste. It is bad, but OK for alc. free.
Clear amber color with huge carbonation, and small white head. Strong grain aroma. Light to medium bitterness. Light alcohol presence on palate. Bad one, you missed style completely.

Clear dark amber to light brown color with small brownish head. Light cherry and chestnut aroma. Medium fruity sweetness. I expected something a lot more flavorful. This beer only give "hints" about what is should be, but nothing more. Palate aroma fades away almost instantly.
UPDATED: FEB 14, 2016
On tap at Pivnica Union, Ljubljana. Red color with big white head. Very ligh malty aroma. Light sweet taste. Really drinkable beer, but some aroma fullness is lacking.

On tap at Pivnica Union, Ljubljana. Golden color with big, thick white head. Grass and hay aroma. Sweet taste with little harsh aftertaste. Medium body and well covered alcohol aroma, but you can feel it is strong.
On tap at Pivnica Union, Ljubljana. Clear golden color with small white head and citrus smell. Hoppy aroma. Medium sweet and light bitter taste. One solid IPA.
Canned 0.5L. Clear golden color with small white head. Grainy aroma. The best budget beer.

Medium dark brown color without head. Burned malt aroma. Taste starts sweet with quite malty bitter finish. Light carbonation. But this aroma fades too fast, after some time aroma fades almost completely.
Canned 0.5L. Clear yellow color, small white head. Grain aroma. Taste is grainy sweet. Better than 3% version, but not great lager. Only plus is this non bitterness.
Canned 0.5L. Clear yellow color, small white head. Watery, light grainy. Not bitter as I expected, but it is not worth drinking.

Clear golden/orange color(little darker than average industrial lager), no foam. Plain and light malty aroma. Light bitter taste. Some alcohol and bitterness present on palate. Really disappointed in this one.
Cloudy golden color with small white head. Sweet taste. Yeast and very grain aroma. Medium palate. Easy going, but preferred for warmer times.

Some strange mix and color leveling between brown, orange and red , with small brown fast disappearing head. Smell is somewhere between red wine and Belgian ale. When you start drinking it you expect that wine like sourness will kick you. But the sourness is well balanced with fruity and sugar sweetness. Body is light to medium with nice lasting light wine sourness in aftertaste. I was expecting richer flavor. This is my first sour so, ATM I am not big sour connoisseur, but this one is some nice mix of sour and Belgian ale.

Orange color with huge white head. Fruity smell. Yeast and banana aroma with some sweet taste. Coriander and some sweet and spicy, but dry notes at the end. Full body with lively aroma. It is really flavorful and hard beer.
Dark orange/brown color with small white head. Light sweet and light bitter taste. Citrus and hoppy aroma. Little ligher taste than what I want from IPA.
Dark brown color with big brown head. Smokey aroma, somewhere between wood and meat, with some malty notes. Taste is salty. Full palate aroma. Really awesome smoked beer.
